items.title: CVE-2025-14733: WatchGuard Firebox Out of Bounds Write Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: WatchGuard Fireware OS iked process contains an out of bounds write vulnerability in the OS iked process. This vulnerability may allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code and affects both the mobile user VPN with IKEv2 and the branch office VPN using IKEv2 when configured with a dynamic gateway peer.

items.title: CVE-2025-14611: Gladinet CentreStack and Triofox Hard Coded Cryptographic Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Gladinet CentreStack and TrioFox contain a hardcoded cryptographic keys vulnerability for their implementation of the AES cryptoscheme. This vulnerability degrades security for public exposed endpoints that may make use of it and may offer arbitrary local file inclusion when provided a specially crafted request without authentication.

items.title: CVE-2025-43529: Apple Multiple Products Use-After-Free WebKit Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Apple iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and other Apple products contain a use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to memory corruption. This vulnerability could impact HTML parsers that use WebKit, including but not limited to Apple Safari and non-Apple products which rely on WebKit for HTML processing.

items.title: CVE-2018-4063: Sierra Wireless AirLink ALEOS Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Sierra Wireless AirLink ALEOS contains an unrestricted upload of file with dangerous type vulnerability. A specially crafted HTTP request can upload a file, resulting in executable code being uploaded, and routable, to the webserver. An attacker can make an authenticated HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability. The impacted product could be end-of-life (EoL) and/or end-of-service (EoS). Users should discontinue product utilization.

items.title: CVE-2025-27915: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) contains a cross-site scripting vulnerability that exists in the Classic Web Client due to insufficient sanitization of HTML content in ICS files. When a user views an e-mail message containing a malicious ICS entry, its embedded JavaScript executes via an ontoggle event inside a tag. This allows an attacker to run arbitrary JavaScript within the victims session, potentially leading to unauthorized actions such as setting e-mail filters to redirect mes...
audience_notes.engineer_detail:
CVE-2025-27915: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) contains a cross-site scripting vulnerability that exists in the Classic Web Client due to insufficient sanitization of HTML content in ICS files. When a user views an e-mail message containing a malicious ICS entry, its embedded JavaScript executes via an ontoggle event inside a tag. This allows an attacker to run arbitrary JavaScript within the victims session, potentially leading to unauthorized actions such as setting e-mail filters to redirect messages to an attacker-controlled address. As a result, an attacker can perform unauthorized actions on the victims account, including e-mail redirection and data exfiltration.

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2025-27915: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability.

What it means: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) contains a cross-site scripting vulnerability that exists in the Classic Web Client due to insufficient sanitization of HTML content in ICS files. When a user views an e-mail message containing a malicious ICS entry, its embedded JavaScript executes via an ontoggle event inside a tag. This allows an attacker to run arbitrary JavaScript within the victims session, potentially leading to unauthorized actions such as setting e-mail filters to redirect messages to an attacker-controlled address. As a result, an attacker can perform unauthorized actions on the victims account, including e-mail redirection and data exfiltration.

Click the link to read more and learn about this topic.

raw.source_title: CVE-2025-27915: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

items.title: CVE-2020-24363: TP-link TL-WA855RE Missing Authentication for Critical Function Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: TP-link TL-WA855RE contains a missing authentication for critical function vulnerability. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated attacker (on the same network) to submit a TDDP_RESET POST request for a factory reset and reboot. The attacker can then obtain incorrect access control by setting a new administrative password. The impacted products could be end-of-life (EoL) and/or end-of-service (EoS). Users should discontinue product utilization.

items.title: CVE-2016-10033: PHPMailer Command Injection Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: PHPMailer contains a command injection vulnerability because it fails to sanitize user-supplied input. Specifically, this issue affects the mail() function of class.phpmailer.php script. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

items.title: CVE-2024-0769:  D-Link DIR-859 Router Path Traversal Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: D-Link DIR-859 routers contain a path traversal vulnerability in the file /hedwig.cgi of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. Manipulation of the argument service with the input ../../../../htdocs/webinc/getcfg/DHCPS6.BRIDGE-1.xml allows for the leakage of session data potentially enabling privilege escalation and unauthorized control of the device. This vulnerability affects legacy D-Link products. All associated hardware revisions have reached their end-of-life (EOL) or end-of-service (...
audience_notes.engineer_detail:

Manipulation of the argument service with the input ../../../../htdocs/webinc/getcfg/DHCPS6.BRIDGE-1.xml allows for the leakage of session data potentially enabling privilege escalation and unauthorized control of the device. This vulnerability affects legacy D-Link products. All associated hardware revisions have reached their end-of-life (EOL) or end-of-service (EOS) life cycle and should be retired and replaced per vendor instructions.

items.title: CVE-2023-0386: Linux Kernel Improper Ownership Management Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Linux Kernel contains an improper ownership management vulnerability, where unauthorized access to the execution of the setuid file with capabilities was found in the Linux kernels OverlayFS subsystem in how a user copies a capable file from a nosuid mount into another mount. items.title: CVE-2025-32433: Erlang Erlang/OTP SSH Server Missing Authentication for Critical Function Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Erlang Erlang/OTP SSH server contains a missing authentication for critical function vulnerability. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands without valid credentials, potentially leading to unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE). By exploiting a flaw in how SSH protocol messages are handled, a malicious actor could gain unauthorized access to affected systems. This vulnerability could affect various products that implement Erlang/OTP SSH server, includingbut not limit...
audience_notes.engineer_detail:
CVE-2025-32433: Erlang Erlang/OTP SSH Server Missing Authentication for Critical Function Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: Erlang Erlang/OTP SSH server contains a missing authentication for critical function vulnerability. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands without valid credentials, potentially leading to unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE). By exploiting a flaw in how SSH protocol messages are handled, a malicious actor could gain unauthorized access to affected systems. This vulnerability could affect various products that implement Erlang/OTP SSH server, includingbut not limited toCisco, NetApp, and SUSE.

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2025-32433: Erlang Erlang/OTP SSH Server Missing Authentication for Critical Function Vulnerability.

items.title: CVE-2020-3259: Cisco ASA and FTD Information Disclosure Vulnerability

items.title: CVE-2023-36846: Juniper Junos OS SRX Series Missing Authentication for Critical Function Vulnerability

items.title: CVE-2023-20273: Cisco IOS XE Web UI Command Injection Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Cisco IOS XE contains a command injection vulnerability in the web user interface. When chained with CVE-2023-20198, the attacker can leverage the new local user to elevate privilege to root and write the implant to the file system. Cisco identified CVE-2023-20273 as the vulnerability exploited to deploy the implant. CVE-2021-1435, previously associated with the exploitation events, is no longer believed to be related to this activity.

Summary: Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM, previously branded MobileIron Core) contains an authentication bypass vulnerability that allows unauthenticated access to specific API paths. An attacker with access to these API paths can access personally identifiable information (PII) such as names, phone numbers, and other mobile device details for users on a vulnerable system. An attacker can also make other configuration changes including installing software and modifying security profiles on registered devices.

items.title: CVE-2018-0158: Cisco IOS and XE Software Internet Key Exchange Memory Leak Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: A vulnerability in the implementation of Internet Key Exchange Version 1 (IKEv1) functionality in Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.
audience_notes.engineer_detail:
CVE-2018-0158: Cisco IOS and XE Software Internet Key Exchange Memory Leak Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: A vulnerability in the implementation of Internet Key Exchange Version 1 (IKEv1) functionality in Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2018-0158: Cisco IOS and XE Software Internet Key Exchange Memory Leak Vulnerability.

What it means: A vulnerability in the implementation of Internet Key Exchange Version 1 (IKEv1) functionality in Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

Click the link to read more and learn about this topic.

items.title: CVE-2017-8540: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Improper Restriction of Operations Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: The Microsoft Malware Protection Engine running on Microsoft Forefront and Microsoft Defender on Microsoft Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016, Microsoft Exchange Server 2013 and 2016, does not properly scan a specially crafted file leading to memory corruption. aka Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

CVE-2017-8540: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Improper Restriction of Operations Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: The Microsoft Malware Protection Engine running on Microsoft Forefront and Microsoft Defender on Microsoft Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016, Microsoft Exchange Server 2013 and 2016, does not properly scan a specially crafted file leading to memory corruption. aka Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2017-8540: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Improper Restriction of Operations Vulnerability.

What it means: The Microsoft Malware Protection Engine running on Microsoft Forefront and Microsoft Defender on Microsoft Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016, Microsoft Exchange Server 2013 and 2016, does not properly scan a specially crafted file leading to memory corruption. aka Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

items.title: CVE-2017-6744: Cisco IOS Software SNMP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS 1 contains a vulnerability that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6.
audience_notes.engineer_detail:
CVE-2017-6744: Cisco IOS Software SNMP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS 1 contains a vulnerability that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6.

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2017-6744: Cisco IOS Software SNMP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

What it means: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS 1 contains a vulnerability that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6.

Click the link to read more and learn about this topic.

items.title: CVE-2018-11776: Apache Struts Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Apache Struts contains a vulnerability that allows for remote code execution under two circumstances. One, where the alwaysSelectFullNamespace option is true and the value isnt set for a result defined in underlying configurations and in same time, its upper package configuration have no or wildcard namespace.  Or, using URL tag which doesnt have value and action set and in same time, its upper package configuration have no or wildcard namespace.
audience_notes.engineer_detail:
CVE-2018-11776: Apache Struts Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: Apache Struts contains a vulnerability that allows for remote code execution under two circumstances. One, where the alwaysSelectFullNamespace option is true and the value isnt set for a result defined in underlying configurations and in same time, its upper package configuration have no or wildcard namespace.  Or, using URL tag which doesnt have value and action set and in same time, its upper package configuration have no or wildcard namespace.

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2018-11776: Apache Struts Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

What it means: Apache Struts contains a vulnerability that allows for remote code execution under two circumstances. One, where the alwaysSelectFullNamespace option is true and the value isnt set for a result defined in underlying configurations and in same time, its upper package configuration have no or wildcard namespace.  Or, using URL tag which doesnt have value and action set and in same time, its upper package configuration have no or wildcard namespace.

Click the link to read more and learn about this topic.

items.title: CVE-2020-3452: Cisco ASA and FTD Read-Only Path Traversal Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) contain an improper input validation vulnerability when HTTP requests process URLs.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request containing directory traversal character sequences to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to view arbitrary files within the web services file system on the targeted device.

items.title: CVE-2020-0601: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) contains a spoofing vulnerability in the way it validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source. A successful exploit could also allow the attacker to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks and decrypt confidential information on user connections to the affected sof...
audience_notes.engineer_detail:
CVE-2020-0601: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) contains a spoofing vulnerability in the way it validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source. A successful exploit could also allow the attacker to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks and decrypt confidential information on user connections to the affected software. The vulnerability is also known under the moniker of CurveBall.

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2020-0601: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability.

What it means: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) contains a spoofing vulnerability in the way it validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source. A successful exploit could also allow the attacker to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks and decrypt confidential information on user connections to the affected software. The vulnerability is also known under the moniker of CurveBall.

Click the link to read more and learn about this topic.

raw.source_title: CVE-2020-0601: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability

items.title: CVE-2019-18988: TeamViewer Desktop Bypass Remote Login Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: TeamViewer Desktop allows for bypass of remote-login access control because the same AES key is used for different customers installations. If an attacker were to know this key, they could decrypt protected information stored in registry or configuration files or decryption of the Unattended Access password to the system (which allows for remote login to the system).
audience_notes.engineer_detail:
CVE-2019-18988: TeamViewer Desktop Bypass Remote Login Vulnerability from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities.

Summary: TeamViewer Desktop allows for bypass of remote-login access control because the same AES key is used for different customers installations. If an attacker were to know this key, they could decrypt protected information stored in registry or configuration files or decryption of the Unattended Access password to the system (which allows for remote login to the system).

See original source for technical details.
audience_notes.learner_explain:
This is an update from CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities about: CVE-2019-18988: TeamViewer Desktop Bypass Remote Login Vulnerability.

What it means: TeamViewer Desktop allows for bypass of remote-login access control because the same AES key is used for different customers installations. If an attacker were to know this key, they could decrypt protected information stored in registry or configuration files or decryption of the Unattended Access password to the system (which allows for remote login to the system).

Click the link to read more and learn about this topic.

raw.source_title: CVE-2019-18988: TeamViewer Desktop Bypass Remote Login Vulnerability

items.title: CVE-2017-9248: Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX and Sitefinity Cryptographic Weakness Vulnerability

audience_notes.exec_brief: Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX and Sitefinity have a cryptographic weakness in Telerik.Web.UI.dll that can be exploited to disclose encryption keys (Telerik.Web.UI.DialogParametersEncryptionKey and/or the MachineKey), perform cross-site-scripting (XSS) attacks, compromise the ASP.NET ViewState, and/or upload and download files.
